rules.title: Project Rules
rules.description: This file contains project-specific coding rules and guidelines that AI agents must follow during implementation.
rules.purpose_text: These rules are automatically loaded and enforced by all Purposely slash commands (`/purposely-implement`, `/purposely-plan`, etc.) to ensure consistent, high-quality code.

how_to_use.step2: AI agents will read and apply these rules during implementation
how_to_use.step3: Update these rules as your project evolves

naming.title: Naming Conventions
naming.dont: DON'T create duplicate code with version suffixes:
naming.do: DO refactor or replace existing code:
naming.good1: Refactor the original if behavior needs to change
naming.good2: Use feature flags if both versions need to coexist temporarily
naming.good3: Archive old code in git history, don't keep it in the codebase

duplication.title: Code Duplication
duplication.bad1: Extract common functionality into shared utilities
duplication.bad2: Use inheritance or composition when appropriate
duplication.good2: Create base classes or utility functions

file_org.title: File Organization
file_org.do: DO maintain single source of truth:
file_org.good1: One canonical location for each type of code

ai_watermarks.title: AI Watermarks and Attribution
ai_watermarks.dont: DON'T leave AI traces in code:
ai_watermarks.exception_text: IMPLEMENTATION.md can mention AI assistance for documentation purposes.
ai_watermarks.bad1: Bad: `# Generated by Claude Code` in source files
ai_watermarks.bad2: Bad: `# Created by AI` or `# AI-generated` comments
ai_watermarks.bad3: Bad: `@author Claude` or `@author AI` in docstrings
ai_watermarks.bad4: Bad: `<!-- Created with LLM -->` in HTML/templates
ai_watermarks.bad5: Bad: Any reference to AI tools in production code
ai_watermarks.good1: Use standard author attribution (developer name or team name)
ai_watermarks.good2: Write comments that explain WHY, not tool used
ai_watermarks.good3: Code should look human-written and professional
ai_watermarks.good4: Remove all AI tool watermarks and signatures

db.title: Example: Database Access
db.description: All database queries must go through the Repository pattern.

api.title: Example: API Responses
api.description: All API responses must use standard response format.

enforcement.violation_title: If you need to violate a rule:
enforcement.violation1: Document the exception in the IMPLEMENTATION.md
enforcement.violation2: Add a TODO to refactor later
enforcement.violation3: Update this RULES.md if the exception becomes permanent
